The substitution method is a process used to solve linear equations. It involves replacing one of the variables in the equation with a number and then solving for the other variable. How do you calculate the percent composition of a compound?To calculate percent (molecular) composition, you need to know the molar mass of the compound and the mass and moles of each element present in the sample. The molycular mass is the sum of atomic masses of all elements present.
You can use the formula for calculating the molecular composition as follows: 
Mass of compound = Molecular mass * Moles compound
Percent composition = (Mass compound / Total mass sample) * 100
Where: Mass of Compound = Mass compound * mols compound (this is equal to the product of mass compound with mol compound) Molar Mass = Sum of Atomic masses for all atoms in compound Total Mass Sample = sum all masses (mass of sample * mass % of element) Mass Compounds = mass all compounds (in g) Total molecules = molic mass (mol) ------- Example 2H2
